latestVersion.versionNote: Includes legislator estimates comparable over time.

fields.value: Replication data for: Elite Preferences in a Consolidating Democracy

authorAffiliation.value: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

dsDescriptionValue.value: Includes replication materials as well as a web appendix to the original paper that presents supplemental results and details of the estimation process that were omitted from journal version due to space constraints. The original survey materials used in this and other publications can be found in the Brazilan Legislative Surveys Dataverse.

publicationCitation.value: Elite Preferences in a Consolidating Democracy: The Brazilian Legislative Surveys, 1990â€“2009. Latin America Politics and Society. Forthcoming 2013.

value: Previous estimates of ideological positions of legislators based on earlier surveys are available here here

Alternative estimates of the ideology of brazilian legislators that combine surveys and roll calls are available here. These are available for a much wider range of legislators, and with information that permits identifying legislator by name. However, these are a much more indirect product of the original data than estimates presented in this study.

files.description: (R syntax code) Reads in the EconDataSet.Rdta data, and performs the analysis of the impact of ideology on preferences about the economy.
files.label: __analyze_econ_replic.R

dataFile.description: (R syntax code) Reads in the EconDataSet.Rdta data, and performs the analysis of the impact of ideology on preferences about the economy.

files.description: (R Data file) Data set combining rescaled positions of legislators and answers on the economic preference question. To be analyzed with _analyze_econ_replic.R
files.label: EconDataSet.Rdta

dataFile.description: (R Data file) Data set combining rescaled positions of legislators and answers on the economic preference question. To be analyzed with _analyze_econ_replic.R

files.description: (Stata data file) Same as EconDataSet.Rdta, but in stata format.
files.label: EconDataSet.tab

dataFile.description: (Stata data file) Same as EconDataSet.Rdta, but in stata format.

files.description: File includes self placement and rescaled self placement of all respondents to all waves (1-6) of the BLS surveys. Legislator names were replaced with a numeric code and state was excluded for anonymity.  Year and party is provided. Rescaled estimates are provided in a raw scale (roughly 1-10) and in a zero centered scale. Estimates are comparable over time. See paper of estimation details.
files.label: estimates_legislators.tab

dataFile.description: File includes self placement and rescaled self placement of all respondents to all waves (1-6) of the BLS surveys. Legislator names were replaced with a numeric code and state was excluded for anonymity.  Year and party is provided. Rescaled estimates are provided in a raw scale (roughly 1-10) and in a zero centered scale. Estimates are comparable over time. See paper of estimation details.

files.description: Party ideological estimates (and standard errors) for party/years, in the "natural" 1-10 scale.
files.label: estimates_scale10.csv

dataFile.description: Party ideological estimates (and standard errors) for party/years, in the "natural" 1-10 scale.

files.description: Party ideological estimates (and standard errors) for party /years, in the zero centered scale.
files.label: estimates_zerocentered.csv

dataFile.description: Party ideological estimates (and standard errors) for party /years, in the zero centered scale.

files.description: (R syntax file) This is the main replication file that reads in and prepares the data, invokes the jags model, and stores results of the estimation of legislators true ideological positions..
files.label: __rescaleBayes_replic.R

dataFile.description: (R syntax file) This is the main replication file that reads in and prepares the data, invokes the jags model, and stores results of the estimation of legislators true ideological positions..

files.description: (R Data File)  A subset of the original BLS survey data, containing only ideological placement responses, in long format. Legislator names have been omitted to conform to IRB requirements. This file is read by _rescaleBayes_replic.R.
files.label: survey.data.replicLAPS.RData

dataFile.description: (R Data File)  A subset of the original BLS survey data, containing only ideological placement responses, in long format. Legislator names have been omitted to conform to IRB requirements. This file is read by _rescaleBayes_replic.R.
